Klasse MariaAccessObject

java.lang.Object
persistence.DataAccessObject
persistence.mariaDB.MariaAccessObject
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
Serializable
Bekannte direkte Unterklassen:
AnswerDAO_MariaDB, QuestionDAO_MariaDB, ThemeDAO_MariaDB
public abstract class MariaAccessObject extends DataAccessObject
Abstract base class for all MariaDB Data Access Objects (DAOs).

Extends DataAccessObject with database-specific functionality and common metadata required for MariaDB persistence.

Responsibilities:

  • Defines the common entity ID handling for MariaDB entities
  • Declares abstract SQL statement methods for SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE
  • Provides an abstract contract for setting PreparedStatement parameters
  • Declares validation logic for subclasses

Subclasses must implement all abstract methods to perform database operations for specific entities like Themes, Questions, or Answers.

Seit:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Autor:
Christos Poulios

  • Konstruktordetails

    • MariaAccessObject

      public MariaAccessObject()
      Default constructor for a new entity (unsaved).

      Initializes the ID to 0, indicating this is a new entity that has not been persisted yet.

    • MariaAccessObject

      public MariaAccessObject(int id)
      Constructor for an existing entity with a specific ID.

      Initializes the ID to the provided value, indicating this entity has been persisted in the database.

      Parameter:
      id - the unique identifier of the existing entity

      public abstract boolean isNew()
      Checks if this entity is new (unsaved).
      Gibt zurück:

    • setPreparedStatementParameters

      public abstract void setPreparedStatementParameters(PreparedStatement ps) throws SQLException
      Sets the parameters on the given PreparedStatement for executing SQL INSERT or UPDATE operations.
      Parameter:
      ps - the prepared statement to configure
      Löst aus:
      SQLException - if setting parameters fails

    • performValidation

      protected abstract boolean performValidation()
      Template method for entity-specific validation logic. Subclasses should override this to check constraints and throw IllegalArgumentException if data is invalid.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if validation passed without exception
